text:
Consumers can henceforth pay their bi-monthly power consumption charges at the e-service centres run by the Tamil Nadu Arasu Cable TV Corporation functioning at the 11 taluk offices in the district.

The power charges can be paid between 9.45 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the service centres, Collector K.S.Palanisamy said in a press release. Consumers paying the bills at these centres would have to pay service charges at the following slabs:

Rs.10 for bills below Rs.1000; Rs.20 for bill amounts ranging from Rs.1,001 to Rs.3,000; Rs.30 for amounts ranging from Rs.3001 to Rs.5,000; Rs.40 for bills ranging from Rs.5,001 to Rs.10,000 and Rs.50 for bills above Rs.10,000.

Special camps to include new voters

Applications for inclusion of eligible persons in the electoral rolls could be submitted during the special camps to be held at all polling stations on January 31 and February 6, Collector K.S.Palanisamy said in a press release. All those who have attained the age of 18 as on January 1,2016 can apply for inclusions.

Applications can also be filed through the websitewww.elections.tn.gov.in
title: e-service centres to accept power bills
